item.title: Ticket #9597 (After a certain time I lose sound.) created
item.dc:creator: Premislaus
item.description:
After a few hours of using Haiku, when I want to listen music, or watch movie, I have no sound! After boot sound works good. Restart of Media Services in Media preflet do not help.

I do not know from when this error occurs. Over the last few days I use Haiku many hours a day. That is probably why I notice this.

item.title: Ticket #9594 ([net_server] IPv6 Link Local prevents proper interface deletion) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
This is hrev45432.

ifconfig del /dev/net/ipro1000/0

deletes the interface from ifconfig, but leaves it in net_device_interfaces list.
So if one tries to bring back the interface he will get an error:

ifconfig /dev/net/ipro1000/0 up
ifconfig: Couldn't add interface: General system error

Removing /system/add-ons/kernel/network/protocols/ipv6 module
or commenting out ​_ConfigureIPv6LinkLocal fixes it.

item.title: Ticket #9592 ([Keymap] don't invalidate everything in KeyboardLayoutView) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
From ticket:8370#comment:13:

"The trick is to only invalidate the area that changed, and make your code in Draw() smart enough not to update everything everytime.
Which the ​KeyboardLayoutView currently doesn't do, though."

item.title: Ticket #9591 ([Network] it shouldn't be possible to auto-config an interface with no ...) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
Currently ifconfig configures link-local address on interfaces with no link.

<mmlr_thinkpad> it's just buggy/not fully implemented
<mmlr_thinkpad> it doesn't actually check the link state
<mmlr_thinkpad> indeed for wireless networks this will have to be reworked anyway
<mmlr_thinkpad> or any network where link != usable
<mmlr_thinkpad> dailup, vpn for example
<mmlr_thinkpad> or maybe "link" should be reworked so that it actually means usable
<mmlr_thinkpad> for wireless link usually means an association with an ap is there
<mmlr_thinkpad> for wpa this doesn't mean that the link is actually usable though, because the wpa handshake needs to be completed first
<mmlr_thinkpad> usually you don't notice that as it's rather quick and the dhcp requests are simply retried
<mmlr_thinkpad> it's not exactly correct either way though

item.title: Ticket #9590 ([Network] preflet doesn't update the list of interfaces on the fly) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
This is hrev45428.

The Network preflet doesn't reflect changes to the list of interfaces.

To reproduce:

  • Open the preflet
  • ifconfig del /dev/net/ipro1000/0 ifconfig /dev/net/foo/0 up

Same applies to NetworkStatus.

item.title: Ticket #9589 (WD Elements USB drive not found) created
item.dc:creator: markh
item.description:
I have a WD Elements 500GB external USB drive.
If I attach it to the computer, Haiku writes the following in the syslog, but doesn't do anything else with it:

KERN: usb hub 83: KERN: port 1: new device connected
KERN: usb_disk: device reports a lun count of 1
KERN: usb_disk: vendor_identification "WD "
KERN: usb_disk: product_identification "Elements 1042 "
KERN: usb_disk: product_revision_level "1019"
KERN: usb_disk: unhandled ioctl 24

I can attach an USB stick and that is recognized fine. I am using it to boot Haiku from the stick.

item.title: Ticket #9588 (Needed Icons and art work.) created
item.dc:creator: richienyhus
item.description:
This ticket is here to keep track of icons that are missing or will be needed in the future and any other system art work desired.

3D System Icons

  • Network Share Icon is still in the old style. #9554
  • System bin icons CortexAddOnHost and Spamdbm. #1429
  • x-pdf & x-vnd.agmsmith file type icons #1429
  • GLife screensaver
  • Dictionary | system accessories

2D Toolbar Icons

  • Spell check | Word Processors
  • Bookmark | BePdf, browers &c
  • shredder | misc
  • Show sidebar | BePdf
  • Find Next | Misc, Bepdf
  • Find Last | Misc
  • Add row to table | Word Processors
  • Add column to table | Word Processors
  • Remove row from table | Word Processors
  • Remove column from table | Word Processors
  • New mail Icon | Mail apps
  • New word doc | Word Processors
  • Merge cells | Word Processors
  • split cell | Word Processors
  • Add Bookmark | Word Processors, browsers
  • Overline text | Word Processors
  • Add Symbol | Word Processors, Misc
  • Add 12 pt space | Word Processors
  • Remove 12 pt space | Word Processors
  • 1.5 line spacing | Word Processors
  • Force Left to Right text | Word Processors
  • Force Right to Left text | Word Processors
  • Edit Header | Word Processors
  • Edit Footer | Word Processors
  • Remove Header | Word Processors
  • Remove Footer | Word Processors
  • appointment-new | calendar
  • folder-new | misc

Other Artwork

  • weather-clear
  • weather-clear-night
  • weather-few-clouds
  • weather-few-clouds-night
  • weather-fog
  • weather-overcast
  • weather-severe-alert
  • weather-showers

item.title: Ticket #9585 (Pe's keyboard shortcuts inconsistent with other apps using Dvorak keymap) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
Most BeOS and Haiku apps (not to mention Windows works this way too) I've come across remap the Z/X/C/V keys for the undo/cut/copy/paste and other common shortcuts. Though it's less intuitive, it is the norm, so I would say Dvorak typists in general are used to hitting e.g. Alt+I or Ctrl+I, where I is physically the I key on the keyboard that the keymap maps to C, to copy. Pe for some reason undoes this, so you have to physically hit Alt+C even using the Dvorak keymap, which Pe correctly tells you under that keymap is Alt+J.

This is confusing. You have to use one set of keyboard shortcuts under Pe and then think differently in whatever other app you are copying/pasting from/to. It should all work one way, and if you really want to do this, have some kind of preflet option in Keymap that lets you choose to either remap them all (as is normal) or DON'T remap when it comes to keyboard shortcuts (as would have been nice from the beginning and if other OSes had this support too.) I have a feeling this would be a lot more work than just changing Pe to fit the norm.

On hrev45413 gcc4h.

item.title: Ticket #9582 (x86_64 nightly missing Radeon driver, Shortcuts preflet) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
I have two Haiku partitions, so how I normally install a nightly is to boot into my non-nightly partition, format the nightly partition, mount a raw nightly image, and run Installer from the mounted image. However, when I tried downloading x86_64 of hrev45413, it said it couldn't open Installer with application Installer. So, I just used Tracker to drag all the files from the mounted image onto my now-empty nightly partition, then ran makebootable on it just in case. It boots up fine on my Sempron 3100+ (yay!) but there seem to be standard things missing, two mentioned in the title. Because there's no driver the display gets set to 1024x768 and when I try to up it to 1280, the screen goes blank until it times out and resets to 1024.

Anyway, do these things not build yet under 64? Here's a list of what's included

~> ls -R /boot/home/config/settings/deskbar/
/boot/home/config/settings/deskbar/:
Applications Demos Desktop applets Preferences

/boot/home/config/settings/deskbar/Applications:
ActivityMonitor DriveSetup StyledEdit WebPositive
Debugger Installer Terminal

/boot/home/config/settings/deskbar/Demos:
BSnow Cortex FontDemo OverlayImage Pairs Sudoku

/boot/home/config/settings/deskbar/Desktop applets:
NetworkStatus ProcessController

/boot/home/config/settings/deskbar/Preferences:
Appearance FileTypes Media Printers Touchpad
Backgrounds Keyboard Mouse Screen Tracker
DataTranslations Keymap Network ScreenSaver VirtualMemory
Deskbar Locale Notifications Time

item.title: Ticket #9581 (Add Liberation Fonts to Haiku (and aliases)) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description:
Haiku right now has very few fonts. Especially when it comes to web browsing, a lot of sites want Arial, Times, and Courier New. These fonts are proprietary, but Red Hat created the Liberation fonts (​https://fedorahosted.org/liberation-fonts/) which are metrically compatible with them.

However, it's not just that the fonts have to be installed. When a program requests "Times New Roman" and Times ISN'T installed (someone may install the real "Times New Roman" of their own accord) Haiku should set the font to be "Liberation Serif". The same should happen with "Arial" and "Courier New".

The font aliases shouldn't just be for Web+. GoBe Productive may open a document and request one of these fonts because the document has it.

item.title: Ticket #9579 (Implement a simple way to set default apps/handlers) created
item.dc:creator: Giova84
item.description:
Currently we can set preferred apps using File Types panel, and works good. But the usage could be obscure (especially for a newbie). As example i suggest to implement a way to set the default browser.
In my case, inside File Types, i have set Qupzilla as default browser, and to do this i have set Qupzilla to handle html files, http url, https url, fpt url and any mime type related to web. I was able to do this because i know very well Haiku, but is not a quick way, because every mime type that i have set, may be not easy to find in the list (eg html file is under "text" category and web urls are categorized under applications, and a new "web" category would be also fine :-).
The same, obviously, could be done for MediaPlayers: i have set another mediaplayer in a quick way setting this on the root category of audio and video, but a new window "Set preferred applications" would be a more clear and elegant way :-)
